usa: The FBI was established, with J. Edgar Hoover as its first director.<sup id="cite_ref-139" class="reference">[139]</sup>
The Works Progress Administration was established.<sup id="cite_ref-140" class="reference">[140]</sup>
The Social Security Act was signed into law; establishing the Social Security Administration.<sup id="cite_ref-141" class="reference">[141]</sup>
Schechter Poultry Corp. v. United States: The Supreme Court ruled that the National Industrial Recovery Act, a central piece of President Roosevelt's New Deal program, was unconstitutional.[142]
The National Labor Relations Act was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-143" class="reference">[143]</sup>
The Motor Carrier Act was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-digitalcommons_144-0" class="reference">[144]</sup>
The Revenue Act of 1935 was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-145" class="reference">[145]</sup>
The Neutrality Act of 1935 was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-146" class="reference">[146]</sup>
Louisiana Senator Huey Long was assassinated.<sup id="cite_ref-147" class="reference">[147]</sup>
The Congress of Industrial Organizations was founded.<sup id="cite_ref-148" class="reference">[148]</sup>
